title: İsmet İnönü
deleted: The Lausanne conference convened in late 1922 to settle the terms of a new treaty that would take the place of the [[Treaty of Sèvres]]. Inönü became famous for his stubborn resolve in determiningAnkara'sposition as the legitimate, sovereign government of Turkey. After delivering his position, Inönü turned off his hearing aid during the speeches of British foreign secretary [[George Curzon, 1st Marquess Curzon of Kedleston|Lord Curzon]]. When Curzon had finished, Inönü reiterated his position as if Curzon had never said a word.<ref>Cleveland, William L., and Martin P. Bunton. ''A History of the Modern Middle East''. Boulder: Westview, 2013. Print.</ref>
